channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Sundance prepares for its final Park City festival before moving to Boulder, Colo.
item.description: As the festival prepares to move to Colorado, filmmakers and cinephiles gather to celebrate its founder and the future of indie film.
item.content:encoded:
As the festival prepares to move to Colorado, filmmakers and cinephiles gather to celebrate its founder and the future of indie film.

(Image credit: Mandalit del Barco)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Public domain contest challenges filmmakers to remix Betty Boop, Nancy Drew and more
item.description: Nearly 280 filmmakers entered the Internet Archive's annual contest celebrating creative freedom without copyright restrictions.
item.content:encoded:
Public Domain Film Remix Contest this year. Above, a still from King of Jazz. The 1930 film was used as source material in several contest submissions.'/>

Nearly 280 filmmakers entered the Internet Archive's annual contest celebrating creative freedom without copyright restrictions.

(Image credit: Universal Pictures/Internet Archive)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: How the word 'cravat' came from the battlefields of 17th century Europe
item.description: In this installment of NPR's "Word of the Week" series we trace the origins of the "cravat" (borrowed from the French "cravate") back to the battlefields of 17th century Europe.
item.content:encoded:
In this installment of NPR's "Word of the Week" series we trace the origins of the "cravat" (borrowed from the French "cravate") back to the battlefields of 17th century Europe.

(Image credit: Hrvoje Polan)
item.dc:creator: Kristina Kukolja

item.title: Brooklyn Beckham accuses David and Victoria of putting branding before family and sabotaging wedding
item.description: A Beckham family falling-out has spilled further into public view in a series of social media posts from Brooklyn Beckham alleging that his parents David and Victoria Beckham have tried to sabotage his marriage and have always prioritized public branding over their family relationships.
item.content:encoded:
A Beckham family falling-out has spilled further into public view in a series of social media posts from Brooklyn Beckham alleging that his parents David and Victoria Beckham have tried to sabotage his marriage and have always prioritized public branding over their family relationships.

(Image credit: Vianney Le Caer)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'Let them.' The small bit of advice that made a big difference to a grieving widow
item.description: Connie Sherburne lost her husband to a plane accident in 2020. A small bit of advice she got from an insurance company employee made a huge difference in her life for years after that.
item.content:encoded: Connie Sherburne lost her husband to a plane accident in 2020. A small bit of advice she got from an insurance company employee made a huge difference in her life for years after that.

item.title: Poet Rachel Eliza Griffiths says she won't let pain be 'the engine that drives the ship'
item.description: On the day Griffiths married author Salman Rushdie, her longtime best friend died unexpectedly. Eleven months later, Rushdie was stabbed multiple times while being interviewed on stage.
item.content:encoded:
On the day Griffiths married author Salman Rushdie, her longtime best friend died unexpectedly. Eleven months later, Rushdie was stabbed multiple times while being interviewed on stage.

(Image credit: Andres Kudacki)
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Here's who's canceled their Kennedy Center performances since Trump took over
item.description: The Seattle Children's Theatre is the latest to say they will no longer perform at the Kennedy Center since Trump took over last year.
item.content:encoded:
The Seattle Children's Theatre is the latest to say they will no longer perform at the Kennedy Center since Trump took over last year.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: Polyester clothing has been causing a stir online. But how valid are the concerns?
item.description: There has been a lot of conversation on social media about the downsides of polyester. But are those downsides as bad as they're believed to be? Are there upsides?
item.content:encoded:
There has been a lot of conversation on social media about the downsides of polyester. But are those downsides as bad as they're believed to be? Are there upsides?

(Image credit: Leon Neal)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Italian fashion designer Valentino dies at 93
item.description: Garavani built one of the most recognizable luxury brands in the world. His clients included royalty, Hollywood stars, and first ladies.
item.content:encoded:
Garavani built one of the most recognizable luxury brands in the world. His clients included royalty, Hollywood stars, and first ladies.

(Image credit: Vittorio Zunino Celotto)
item.dc:creator: Maison Tran

item.title: Martin Luther King Jr. would be inspired by today's activism, author says
item.description: Heather McGhee, author of 2021's The Sum of Us, discusses the economic cost of racism, the importance of community organizing and the "zero-sum lie" that progress for some means loss for others.
item.content:encoded: Heather McGhee, author of 2021's The Sum of Us, discusses the economic cost of racism, the importance of community organizing and the "zero-sum lie" that progress for some means loss for others.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley
